TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ActiveDirectoryAccessRule extends System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAccessRule

Docs.summary: The class is used to represent an access control entry (ACE) in the discretionary access control list (DACL) of an Active Directory Domain Services object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAccessRule> class contains properties of the access rule such as the trustee, access control type, access mask, and inheritance flags. This type of access rule is set on an <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurity> object.
After the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurity> object is committed to the directory store, it will modify the security descriptor of the object according to the rules set on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAccessRule> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference identity, valuetype System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights adRights, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType type) cil managed

Docs.param: An object which identifies the trustee of the access rule.
A combination of one or more of the enumeration values that specifies the rights of the access rule.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified identity reference, Active Directory Domain Services rights, and access rule type.
